content: 6 cc3 wild lavender round 7 cc2 honeydew round 8 cc4 light teal round 9 cc1 blue round 10 cc2 honeydew round 11 cc3 wild lavender round 12 cc4 light teal round 13 cc1 blue round 14 cc2 honeydew round 15 cc4 light teal round 16 cc3 wild lavender round 17 cc1 blue round 18 cc4 light teal round 19 cc3 wild lavender round 20 cc2 honeydew round 21 cc4 light teal round 22 cc1 blue round 23 cc2 honeydew rounds 24 31 cc4 light teal mark round 25 for placement of hanging loop round 32 continue using cc4 chain 1 single_crochet around join with slip_stitch in top of first single_crochet 70 single_crochet fasten_off sew in all loose ends lips join each round with a slip_stitch into the top of the first single_crochet start join in cc1 blue at the mouth opening round 1 chain 1 single_crochet in each st around join 28 single_crochet round 2 chain 1 crab stitch around join 28 single_crochet fasten_off sew in loose ends add elastic thread a double strand of shirring elastic through the first round of mc parchment at the mouth opening gathering the mouth slightly circumference should be approx 10 cm 4 in tie a firm knot to secure fishie the plastic bag keeper - by sharon maher of laughing purple goldfish designs ©2012 5 eyes make 2 join each round with a slip_stitch into the top of the first single_crochet start using cc2 honeydew make an amr round 1 chain 1 8 single_crochet into ring tighten tail join 8 single_crochet round 2 chain 1 2 single_crochet in each st around join 16 single_crochet round 3 chain 1 * 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet repeat from * around join 24 single_crochet change colour fasten_off cc2 honeydew and join in cc3 wild lavender round 4 ch1 single_crochet in each stitch through bl join 24 single_crochet fasten_off leave a 30 cm 12 in tail for attaching position eyes place eyes on the single_crochet section of the face centred beneath the peak of a ripple leave one peak between the eyes refer to photograph below if needed attach stitch the eyes to the face embellish place the small button on top of the large button and stitch to the eye as shown using sewing needle and thread hanging loop this cord acts as a hanging loop and also a closure for the bag start chain a cord 60cm 24 in long using cc3 wild lavender insert thread the cord between the double_crochet stitches of round 25 remove marker knot tie the ends together using an overhand knot leave ends loose fishie the plastic bag keeper - by sharon maher of laughing purple goldfish designs ©2012
